wikiData.title: New Hampshire v. Maine
wikiData.Outcome: Consent decree stipulated between parties and agreed to by parties is permissible under ''[[Vermont v. New York]]'', {{Ussc|417|270|1974}}.  States are not adjusting the boundary between them, which was fixed by the 1740 decree; the consent decree simply locates precisely the already existing boundary, and neither State is enhancing its power and threatening supremacy of the Federal Government.
